document.title: COMPREHENSIVE HEALTH AND PHYSICAL EDUCATION Grades Pre-Kindergarten to 12

0D160D305CB74AE99B220EB589750CC6.description:
Encourage peers and family to help in the community (e.g., donate food to a food pantry, clean
up litter). [HE]

6CB249D47FE84887AA456022C4992667.description:
Encourage peers and family members to make choices to help protect the environment (e.g.,
recycling, using less water, turning off the lights). [HE]

8DF2684C8E09424DBD067DF0B2723321.description: Identify strategies to minimize impact on the environment (e.g., reduce, reuse, recycle). [HE]

F539FB8E6E90425BA6B69CEB3A4957D6.description: Identify ways that the communities people live in can impact their health and well-being. [HPE]

ADC0E584005448BF8A12AAD1D3E33BAB.description:
Identify the impact of personal activities that contribute, positively or negatively, to the
environment. [HE]

5DCC00D928AD4267B7DBE55D2E2E885B.description:
Recognize how the actions of others can impact physical health (e.g., spreading germs)
and encourage peers to make positive choices about physical health habits and prevention
strategies. [HPE]

3F8683CFECBE497592A68076E319EDC1.description:
Self-advocate in order to have personal health needs met (e.g., needing to wash hands,
asking for sun protection, access to bathrooms). [HPE]

27B97053ACBD4A89A4DE124320A720F7.description:
Describe personal health habits (i.e., brushing and flossing teeth, hygiene, hand washing,
sufficient sleep, sun safety, physical activity, limiting screen time) that can prevent illness
and promote self-care and overall health. [HPE]

21388ABE5B01417DBD7B2FB7A1C69CA8.description:
Demonstrate personal hygiene habits and other behaviors that prevent the spread of
illness (including foodborne illness) and infection. [HPE]

1D2379B19C8241E7B3DF97EB42873A9B.description:
Self-Advocacy and Health Promotion.
Promote personal, family, and community health and well-being.

98F2746DB0404DC787ABC27EC27721EC.description:
Identify trusted adults at home and school (e.g., school nurse, guidance counselor) who can
discuss rules and practices related to medicine use (e.g., only taking medicine with an adult’s
help, only taking prescriptions that are prescribed to you). [HE]

57DE2430EC634D6D982D552E43EFFE48.description:
Explain why it is important to use prescription and over-the-counter medicines correctly and
safely, and the risks of ingesting household poisons (e.g., bleach, laundry detergent) and
incorrectly using household products. [HE]

B01B38273A064F958EC99042132223E2.description:
Demonstrate the ability to access help for self or others (e.g., school nurse, counselors, health
and physical educators) to support physical health and hygiene. [HPE; SE]

32FA0CF40B17464F8DDB2B6DD2571A97.description:
Identify individuals who can assist with health-related issues and potentially life-threatening
health conditions (e.g., asthma episodes, allergic reactions, seizures, concussions). [HPE]

16177D17048C48E983B59202929FC212.description: Identify school and community health helpers and community resources. [HPE; SE]

BAA91709BC504F4A8AED576247FBD50D.description:
Information and Resource Seeking.
Access, evaluate, and use valid and reliable health information, products, services, and
related resources.

3FDAAD7B336644E2A84584183D145D57.description:
Demonstrate strategies that help all students feel welcome and valued as a part of the school
community (e.g., cooperative playing, listening, showing you care, sharing). [HPE; SE]

11D20117CBDD41C79DE3D04252D58216.description:
Articulate and celebrate the individual characteristics that make a person unique, and explain
that how a person views themselves can be influenced by different factors (e.g., peers, media,
culture, family, phase of life). [HPE; SE]

BEF0B8FA46A64A68BB5583C143B9B2C3.description: Describe personal strengths and the ways that those strengths support mental health. [HPE; SE]

AB533E681E384FCDA37DCC839153E2DA.description:
Demonstrate growth-oriented practices by attempting, repeating, and experimenting with a
variety of experiences and activities. [HPE; SE]

28829EF903A84250983EF89CFB351001.description:
Accept failure and demonstrate the ability to persevere despite real or perceived failures. [HPE;
SE]

17B77660DE14490193F5FC98E2CBDFB4.description:
Demonstrate emotional regulation strategies to support mental and emotional health alone or
with support from adults. [HPE; SE]

03728B7A7D8F49A1AEBCB1C395D72095.description:
Explain that emotions are information and that personal emotions may be the same or different
from the emotions of others. [HPE; SE]

43541CCE2F18484BB880AFEC7C56780E.description:
Recognize and accurately label simple emotions (e.g., happy, sad, mad, worried, lonely). [HPE;
SE]

651E3505D3134D6E83F7F492BFD42B57.description:
Self-awareness and Analyzing Influences.
Examine how emotions, thoughts, needs, values, beliefs, and other factors (both internal
and external) influence behaviors and articulate how these influences impact health
behavior and outcomes.

C9A915127FA948D28616A1261F0E04AC.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate manipulative skills in varying environments (i.e.,
underhand and overhand throwing in a non-dynamic environment, catching, dribbling with
hands and feet, bouncing a ball, volleying, striking, rolling a ball in non-dynamic or dynamic
environments, and kicking). [PE]

792E668F11BB40DEB48D2CDE8F03425D.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate stationary body actions in non-dynamic
environments. [PE]

1D823D7664CC4D7FBC1FE0EE2240AE07.description:
Demonstrate stability skills by maintaining balance and transferring weight (one body part to
another) on different bases of support and combining levels and shapes. [PE]

013982CC2BB94009A45B6E33556F969F.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate jumping and landing (i.e., using a variety of one- and
two-foot take-offs and landings, and jump roping skills). [PE]

661054454142482192421B18EE617D48.description:
Demonstrate the ability to engage in rhythmic movement activities (e.g., move in self-space and
general space in response to designated beats or rhythms, drumball, dance). [PE]

D44512EDFFEA4D6BB5D734AC0C4E1F1D.description:
Demonstrate different levels (low, middle and high), a variety of relationships with objects (i.e.,
over, under, around, through), and ability to vary speed and force while traveling. [PE]

4EAE4A6397E24072BB3C2D28F7B2E1C2.description:
Demonstrate developmentally-appropriate locomotor movements (i.e., hop, gallop, jog, slide,
skip, roll, and run) and movement concepts (i.e., traveling in various pathways, showing
differentiation of speed) in dynamic environments (e.g., incorporated in a dance or rhythm
activity, applied during a game or activity). [PE]

74B71F190DD044918A3A6C4CE24CD1D9.description:
Movement Skills.
Demonstrate competence in, and knowledge of, a variety of movement forms, motor
skills, physical fitness components, and principles in order to engage in purposeful and
health-promoting physical activity, including sports and games.

F8014F8BF0A34DD4974394A52CFB6327.description:
Identify reasons conflict and disagreements may arise in various situations and strategies for
resolving misunderstandings and managing conflict. [HPE; SE]

E2702BB60CC44E48953FDE8319F96CEF.description: Describe positive qualities in self and others. [HPE; SE]

CBFACD8C728E4534A8BA449B03BA71CE.description: Recognize and appreciate individual differences in others. [HPE; SE]

1C0B87E972DF441BBB192940C8F6FB77.description:
Demonstrate effective listening and communication skills, including giving and accepting a
compliment and feedback, individually and in group settings. [HPE; SE]

3819D719A3E44FCFBA92C9A53C0CCEA9.description: Show respect for the feelings, rights, and property of others. [HPE; SE]

885B803C9ABA41A3A64DD1AB73549A3E.description:
Effectively express needs, wants, and feelings through both verbal and non-verbal actions. [HPE;
SE]

D5DC7108D61645A69A7F4FFE6A636EB4.description:
Identify and practice talking to trusted adults, parents/guardians, and/or family members about
feelings. [HPE; SE]

DB440593AA6E4C9BA1D89EC6851FCD65.description:
Identify and practice strategies to make and keep friends, and develop positive peer
relationships (e.g., identify and acknowledge other people’s feelings, communicate effectively,
ask for help). [HPE; SE]

A46BB038EF9243D6B14C8A90834816E7.description:
Identify reasons why it is important to have positive social relationships (e.g., positive emotions,
support and help, someone to play with). [HPE; SE]

BA279A3FACAD45A085C057F6181745F9.description:
Predict how someone else may feel in a variety of situations and display compassionate and
empathetic behaviors. [HPE; SE]

0D63826F903E4224B75ADFB7D19E4CC5.description:
Demonstrate awareness of, and ways to show respect for, different family structures (e.g.,
families with heterosexual parents, families with same-gender parents, single parent families,
intergenerational families, adoptive families, foster families). [HE; SE]

8EE589128D0A444FBB3A42810A35D006.description:
Acknowledge diversity, including (but not limited to) racial, ethnic, religious, dis/ability and
cultural differences and traditions, and demonstrate respect for others, and demonstrate
empathy and ways to treat all people with dignity and respect. [HPE; SE]

E7F7314A5ED44E929BF2A7218250CF6A.description: Discuss gender-role stereotypes and their potential impacts on people of all genders. [HPE]

3DF136987D6647A396DE5099D174C6E6.description:
Discuss stereotypes, prejudice, discrimination, equality, and inequality and how these can affect
relationships and situations. [HE; SE]

60B8E57B07E34C3C8851A3C8A315E7E4.description:
Recognize the benefits of and strategies for cooperation in a variety of settings (including
physical education). [HPE; SE]

A6B282FB97A443D59EB266FCF1536EDC.description:
Identify groups to which one belongs and reflect on similarities and differences with others.
[HPE; SE]

F5837164506F44EA9D177FB406992C0A.description:
Explain how no one has a right to violate personal boundaries, and demonstrate an appropriate
refusal (e.g., tell a trusted adult, say NO, leave the situation) when someone says or does
something that does not respect personal boundaries. [HPE]

DA70330E594A41B88A6092C7F3073594.description:
Define and demonstrate simple ways to communicate personal boundaries and respect the
boundaries of others, including physical, verbal, sexual, and emotional boundaries (e.g., explain
why it is important to tell others not to touch their body when they do not want to be touched
and why it is important to stop touching someone when they indicate the touch is
unwelcome). [HPE]

ED07A50CE2EA4FDD8864BD036B8947EC.description:
Define bullying and teasing, explain similarities and differences, and how both can be harmful.
[HPE; SE]

EDFEB522A37B4232938E751A3ECD0246.description:
Social Awareness, Relationship, and Communication
Skills.
Enhance relationships, personal health, and the health of others through social
awareness and effective communication.

9125679CD532407CB173EBEE89A8997B.description:
Set a short-term physical activity goal relevant to specific needs and abilities, take meaningful
action toward achieving the goal, and identify people at home or at school who can help when
assistance is needed to achieve the goal. [PE]

974C2E5DDED84F519C2739D901FA170E.description:
Identify opportunities, in and out of the school setting, for safe, active play, and physical activity
for self-expression, social interaction, personal enjoyment and challenge. [PE]

CF1254B753A042A2AE969D81FA073F13.description:
Identify physical activity as a health-promoting habit that contributes to overall health and wellbeing, and list the benefits of these habits on physical well-being (e.g., activities that strengthen the heart and cardiovascular system, contribute to fitness, muscle-building) and mental health
(e.g., stress management). [HPE]

6615880586A94A0F93AA919A1181EE30.description:
Participate safely in a variety of physical education situations, including independent, partner
and group activities, with and without equipment. [PE]

51284E4E5E8A4D38A67525C870325D9D.description:
Exhibit prosocial behavior and contribute to the creation and maintenance of safe, supportive
learning environments. [PE; SE]

820AEFF976664E3AB532D04D6BFEFC3A.description:
Identify and describe strengths and interests related to physical activity and movement skills,
and those for which extra effort and practice is needed to experience success. [PE; SE]

C9D1DF6CCEE54542846EB13328159623.description:
Recognize body responses, physiological changes in their bodies, and emotions during
movement and physical activity. [HPE]

EDC98D41F7A0411AA60EE0EAFE7915DC.description:
Exhibit positive self-concept, self-esteem, and confidence in abilities in a variety of settings,
including practicing new movement skills, demonstrating skills to peers, and participating in
cooperative and competitive games and activities. [PE]

28AA0567D711469A90ABE3B44BA2115C.description: Identify and practice behaviors for personal safety: say no, get away, tell a grown-up. [HE]

053537F43E84480481354D54BFFA7543.description:
Recognize safe, unsafe, and inappropriate touching and demonstrate how to tell a trusted adult
if this happens. [HE]

5061E7C88B3447E08A9FB47E99E57B26.description:
Demonstrate the ability to ask a trusted adult for help (including for problem-solving) in a
variety of situations. [HPE; SE]

859ECAB888844A4EABE9EE7E6853584D.description:
Identify safe adults to confide in and places to go if feeling personally threatened (e.g., someone
says they will hurt or harm you). [HE]

8B89B0686F004E28844D6C86FF7712F8.description:
Demonstrate how to respond (e.g., yell, get away, tell an adult, seek help) and get help in a
variety of emergency situations including when and how to call 9-1-1. [HE]

463A2234A936429FB3DEA4D2F65C5CF3.description:
Provide examples of how rules can keep children safe and identify rules to help children stay
safe in various situations (e.g., related to medicines, playground safety, physical education,
threats of violence, personal space, and boundaries). [HPE]

B0A3A56480A749D184DC10DE332F2BF5.description:
Apply strategies for staying safe in a variety of situations (e.g., on the playground, during
physical education, around water, when using wheeled recreation, as a pedestrian, around
cooking elements or fire, on the bus, when online, around weapons or in situations of gun
violence) and determine when to report unsafe situations to an adult. [HPE]

F4FE32FBCD29430FA97DE7D431942318.description:
Set a simple goal related to physical health habits and monitor progress toward the goal with
assistance from an adult. [HPE]

8CC7DCA966FE4E03AEB084256560250A.description:
Demonstrate independence in health-promoting practices such as hand washing, appropriate
teeth brushing motions, sneezing and coughing into elbow, engaging in physical activity, and
appropriate use and disposal of tissues. [HPE]

057F820F73554E348AD99C426BF574CD.description:
Use medically accurate names for body parts, including genitals when communicating about
their body and physical health. [HPE]

8B47B91334CB4CF391C5315461200958.description:
Explain how a young person can maintain or enhance the health of both their body and
mind. [HPE, SE]

6558DDC5D4F848C9BD147791EFF1EA16.description:
Identify a variety of habits that can promote children’s health (e.g., brushing teeth, proper
nutrition, going to the doctor, getting enough sleep, being physically active, limiting screen time,
washing hands, etc.). [HPE]

0CB62E315CE74C76A2D0F908042E6E34.description:
Identify simple goals for health, physical activity, academic success, and classroom behavior.
[HPE; SE]

26AE5CE32D4B4E11A09C4F7DF3B9FF39.description:
Utilize simple positive self-talk for the purpose of self-motivation and behavior
modification. [HPE; SE]

5B137E1E2D4D4268A675472C299C1E34.description: Identify what it means to be responsible and list personal responsibilities. [HPE; SE]

2BC4FE65ED92465390960B1EA6556549.description:
Define stress and demonstrate strategies for managing stress (e.g., positive self-talk, belly
breathing, talking with a trusted adult, listening to calming music, play, physical activity) alone
or with the support of adults. [HPE; SE]

702DA1877FD74927909607DFE9A002CE.description:
Demonstrate self-control (e.g., delay gratification, wait your turn) alone or with the support of
adults in a variety of typical settings (e.g., on the playground, in the classroom, during physical
education, at an assembly). [HPE; SE]

9A6249E85822433CB5D057BD0E0BC1F8.description:
Self-management and Goal Setting.
Set goals, engage in health-promoting behaviors, and avoid risky behaviors.

B2329F851681494D93E1E82D57C18719.description:
Recognize that media (e.g., cartoons, characters, advertisements, product placement) can
impact food-related decisions. [HPE]

DDDF7884E4C540BE934802F4B6A9954B.description:
Describe how the foods students eat may reflect the area in which they live and/or their cultural
backgrounds, ways students’ families use or produce food, how family meals and food traditions
benefit them, different dietary needs (e.g., food allergies, dietary restrictions) and how they
contribute to nutrition-related decisions. [HPE]

506B167687B04632BA7ACCA3AAE8B0CD.description:
Explain benefits of health-promoting eating choices and habits (e.g., balanced eating, staying
hydrated, eating fruits and vegetables, eating nutrient-rich foods, eating a variety of foods,
limiting foods high in added sugar, awareness of hunger and thirst signals). [HPE]

670E9B34DDBD431685F96904785AFF4C.description:
Explain food and health-promoting eating habits in equitable terms (e.g., all people need food
access, clean water is necessary, grocery stores are important to communities and their health,
access, needs, and preferences vary). [HPE]

AC53AC441AC540F29616A69FA8F1150B.description:
Identify that food is the preferred way of obtaining nutrients (as opposed to supplements) and
provides energy for the body, identify the primary contribution of each food group to the body,
and provide examples of foods within food groups to support informed decision-making. [HPE]

D528CD456F4041D08E4D0E8134D50AEB.description:
Articulate, with adult guidance, nutrition options in common situations, and identify decisions
that can be made independently (e.g., asking for healthier options) or when assistance is needed
(e.g., managing a food allergy). [HPE]

C262F3C787154F3CAF10DC7254347122.description:
Identify situations when a nutrition-related decision needs to be made (e.g., when trying new
foods, choosing snacks and beverages, eating breakfast). [HPE]

0D0EA47C2B8844CCA659724418E1EB64.description:
Decision-making and Problem-solving.
Make health-promoting, informed, responsible decisions and solve problems in a variety
of health-related situations.
